summary: This document is a chain of emails from July-August 2019 between defense attorney Joe Nascimento and federal prosecutors, primarily concerning scheduling meetings and travel arrangements for Nascimento's client, a former employee of Jeffrey Epstein. The emails discuss the client's compensation from Epstein, her U.S. citizenship and passport status, and coordination for a proffer meeting.

persons.name: Joe Nascimento
persons.context: Attorney representing a former employee of Jeffrey Epstein, communicating with federal prosecutors to schedule meetings and discuss his client's situation.

persons.name: Alan Ross
persons.context: Deceased former law partner of Joe Nascimento who previously represented the client in question.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Former employer of the client; mentioned as the source of payments for gym membership, English classes, cash, meals, salon appointments, and clothing in 2004-2005.

connections.description: Nascimento is the attorney representing the client, a former employee of Jeffrey Epstein, in communications with federal prosecutors.
The client was a former employee of Jeffrey Epstein who received salary and additional payments from him in 2004-2005.
Nascimento was the former law partner of Alan Ross, who previously represented the same client.

events.title: Initial Meeting in West Palm Beach
events.description: Joe Nascimento met with federal prosecutors at the Hilton in West Palm Beach to discuss his client's case.

events.title: Scheduled Proffer Meeting
events.description: A meeting was scheduled between Joe Nascimento, his client, and federal prosecutors, with discussions about rescheduling to early afternoon.

events.title: Nascimento's International Travel
events.description: Joe Nascimento planned to be out of the country for two trials, indicating scheduling constraints for future meetings.

events.title: Epstein Payments to Client
events.description: The client received payments from Jeffrey Epstein for gym membership, English classes, a cash lump sum (less than $10k), meals, salon appointments, and clothing while working for him.

locations: Miami, FL 33129 (Law office of ROSS AMSEL RABEN NASCIMENTO, PLLC at 2250 S.W. 3rd Avenue)
West Palm Beach, FL (Meeting location at Hilton, 600 Okeechobee Blvd)
keyFacts: The client, a former employee of Jeffrey Epstein, became a U.S. citizen but did not have a U.S. passport and sought government guidance on applying for one while wanting to be transparent.

The client received compensation from Epstein beyond salary in 2004-2005, including payments for gym membership, English classes, a cash lump sum under $10k, and coverage for meals, salon appointments, and clothing.
Joe Nascimento's former law partner, Alan Ross, previously represented the same client before his death in 2018.
Federal prosecutors served a grand jury subpoena on the client, prompting her to contact Nascimento, who then reached out to prosecutors to schedule discussions.

The email chain shows ongoing coordination for a proffer meeting, with the government stating the client is free to obtain a passport and travel with advance notice, indicating she was not under formal travel restrictions at that time.
